sense.name: physical matter left behind after a removal process
sense.examples: The geologist examined the salt residues in the ancient lake bed. This shampoo removes residues that can dull your hair. There are amino acid residues from the hydrolysis of protein. I washed a sticky residue off the kitchen counter.

sense.name: a numerical remainder or balance
sense.examples: They will use the residue of this year's budget to give teachers a raise. 2 and 7 are residues of 12 modulo 5.

sense.name: portion of an estate remaining after settlement of all debts
sense.commentary: RESIDUE[+entity][+asset][+estate][+remaining][+settlement][+debt] Note: a restricted sense of Sense 2, but may involve more than money (other assets, e.g., property, jewelry, artwork, etc.)
sense.examples: There was very little residue from John's father's estate. She contested the residue of her husband's estate with his son's attorneys.
